Initial Quality After Experimental Quality Difference
Acid rain has the least impact on wood.
(_1) Consider the temperature changes before the test, (2) whether the object has fading, (3) whether it has been formed

(_1) Each experiment selects a new experimental material (2) observes the color of the solution in the container and measures the quality (3) calculates whether the concentration of the solution changes

(_1) whether the content of vinegar is reduced (2) whether harmful gases are produced when vinegar reacts with the reagent (3) whether there is any danger throughout the experiment

(_1) measure the quality of four different samples; (2) pour vinegar into four identical containers; (3) place the samples of one of the materials in one container and place the corresponding instructions on the label; and do the same for the other samples;
Effects of acid rain on different materials
(_1) Were there any chemical changes in the samples? (2) What is the pH value? (3) What is the difference between vinegar and acid rain in the material?

Information is also required to include (_1) whether the ambient temperature is constant when processing the sample (2) whether the pH value of vinegar and the pH value of acid rain differ too much (3) whether the change in temperature has an excessive effect on the trial
(_1) The amount of acid rain (2) The amount of acid rain should be sufficient to allow the amount to fully reflect
